item.title: OpenAI removes access to sycophancy-prone GPT-4o model
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description: The model is known for its overly sycophantic nature and its role in several lawsuits involving users' unhealthy relationships to the chatbot.

item.title: AI burnout, billion-dollar bets, and Silicon Valley’s Epstein problem
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha, Kirsten Korosec, Sean O'Kane, Theresa Loconsolo
item.description: AI companies have been hemorrhaging talent the past few weeks. Half of xAI’s founding team has left the company — some on their own, others through “restructuring” — while OpenAI is facing its own shakeups, from the disbanding of its mission alignment team to the firing of a policy exec who opposed its “adult mode” feature.  On this episode of TechCrunch’s Equity podcast, hosts Kirsten […]

item.title: Anthropic’s Super Bowl ads mocking AI with ads helped push Claude’s app into the top 10
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: The numbers suggest that Anthropic's Super Bowl commercials, combined with Anthropic's recent release of its new Opus 4.6 model, worked to drive attention to Claude's app and its key differentiator from ChatGPT.

item.title: Elon Musk suggests spate of xAI exits have been push, not pull
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description: At least nine engineers, including two co-founders, have announced their exits from xAI in the past week, fueling online speculation and raising questions about stability at Musk’s AI company amid mounting controversy.

item.title: Cohere’s $240M year sets stage for IPO
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description: Cohere surpassed $240 million in annual recurring revenue in 2025, highlighting strong enterprise AI demand as the Canadian startup positions itself for a potential IPO amid intensifying competition from OpenAI and Anthropic.

item.title: Meta plans to add facial recognition to its smart glasses, report claims
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: The feature, internally known as “Name Tag,” would allow smart glasses wearers to identify people and get information about them via Meta's AI assistant.

item.title: Amid disappointing earnings, Pinterest claims it sees more searches than ChatGPT
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: Pinterest's stock tumbles after an earnings miss, with higher-than-expected usage its only bright spot.

item.title: IBM will hire your entry-level talent in the age of AI
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Szkutak
item.description: IBM plans to triple its entry-level hiring in the U.S. in 2026, but these jobs will have different tasks than in previous years.

item.title: Musk needed a new vision for SpaceX and xAI. He landed on Moonbase Alpha.
item.dc:creator: Tim Fernholz
item.description: "I really want to see a mass driver on the moon that is shooting AI satellites into deep space."

item.title: Didero lands $30M to put manufacturing procurement on ‘agentic’ autopilot
item.dc:creator: Marina Temkin
item.description: Didero functions as an agentic AI layer that sits on top of a company’s existing ERP, acting as a coordinator that reads incoming communications and automatically executes the necessary updates and tasks.

item.title: Anthropic raises another $30B in Series G, with a new value of $380B
item.dc:creator: Lucas Ropek
item.description: The infusion of funding for the AI startup takes place as it is vying for customers and cultural attention with its competitor, OpenAI.

item.title: Spotify says its best developers haven’t written a line of code since December, thanks to AI
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: Spotify credits Claude Code and its internal AI system Honk with speeding up development.

item.title: A new version of OpenAI’s Codex is powered by a new dedicated chip
item.dc:creator: Lucas Ropek
item.description: OpenAI calls the new coding tool the "first milestone" in its relationship with the chipmaker.

item.title: xAI lays out interplanetary ambitions in public all-hands
item.dc:creator: Russell Brandom
item.description: On Wednesday, xAI took the rare step of publishing its full 45-minute all-hands presentation to the X platform, making it widely available.

item.title: AI inference startup Modal Labs in talks to raise at $2.5B valuation, sources say
item.dc:creator: Marina Temkin
item.description: General Catalyst is in talks to lead the round for the four-year-old startup, according to our sources.

item.title: OpenAI disbands mission alignment team
item.dc:creator: Lucas Ropek
item.description: The team's leader has been given a new role as OpenAI's chief futurist, while the other team members have been reassigned throughout the company.

item.title: Apple’s Siri revamp reportedly delayed… again
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description: While the new Siri was expected to launch with the upcoming iOS 26.4 update in March, now, the changes are expected to roll out more slowly over time, reportedly postponing some features until the May iOS update, or even until the release of iOS 27 in September.

item.title: Uber Eats launches AI assistant to help with grocery cart creation
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description: Uber Eats launched a new AI feature, “Cart Assistant,” that can automatically add items to your cart based on text or image prompts.

item.title: Glean’s fight to own the AI layer inside every company
item.dc:creator: Theresa Loconsolo, Rebecca Bellan
item.description: Enterprise AI is shifting fast from chatbots that answer questions to systems that actually do the work across an organization. But who will own the AI layer that powers all of it?  Glean, which started as an enterprise search product, has evolved into what it calls an “AI work assistant,” aiming to sit beneath other AI […]

item.title: Who will own your company’s AI layer? Glean’s CEO explains
item.dc:creator: Theresa Loconsolo
item.description: Enterprise AI is shifting fast from chatbots that answer questions to systems that actually do the work across an organization. But who will own the AI layer that powers all of it?  Glean, which started as an enterprise search product, has evolved into what it calls an “AI work assistant,” aiming to sit underneath other AI […]
